description: The 'draw_measurement_comparison' function generates a visual representation of measurement comparisons between different objects. It is designed to help students understand the concept of measurement and comparison, by visually representing the lengths of different objects in an easy-to-understand format.

educational_standards.description: Compare the lengths of two objects indirectly by using a third object.
Express the length of an object as a whole number of length units by laying multiple copies of a shorter object end to end.
Understand that the length measurement of an object is the number of same-size length units that span it with no gaps or overlaps.
Estimate lengths using units of centimeters.

stimulus_type_specification.title: Measurement Comparison Visualizations
stimulus_type_specification.description: The 'draw_measurement_comparison' function can draw a range of measurement comparison visualizations, depending on the input it receives. It accepts a list of objects, each with a specified length, a label, and an optional unit of measurement. The function then generates a visual representation of these objects, with their lengths represented proportionally. The objects can be displayed with or without a unit of measurement, and the function can handle up to three objects at a time. This function is particularly useful in teaching students about measurement and comparison, as it allows them to visually compare the lengths of different objects.

details: object_name: The name of the object being measured. This is displayed as an image in the visualization.
length: The length of the object in units of the specified unit of measurement.
unit: The unit of measurement displayed as images measuring the item. If omitted, no unit images are displayed.
label: The label for the object, displayed above the image. If an object is re-used (e.g. 2 pencils), there must be a letter suffixed to the name (e.g. 'Pencil A').
unit_display_error: The error in the unit display, redacted to have no errors.
The length of the object must be between 1 and 12, inclusive.
The list of objects to be measured and compared must contain at least 2 items, but no more than 3.
The label for the object is required, and if an object is re-used, there must be a letter suffixed to the name.
The function generates a visual representation of the objects, with their lengths represented proportionally.
The objects can be displayed with or without a unit of measurement.
The label for each object is displayed above its image.
